intro: Thonningia mexicana, commonly known as the Mexican thonningia, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and opposite, ovate leaves. It produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are clustered in umbels. Thonningia mexicana is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and shrublands.
